value.title: Nvidia's Arm Deal Would Make It the Center of the Chip World
value.excerpt: Combining the two chipmakers would unite leaders in two big tech trends—artificial intelligence and mobile computing.

value.title: Nvidia acquisition of Arm throws company into tech spat between U.S. and China
value.excerpt: Nvidia Corp's $40 billion acquisition of chip designer Arm is set to catapult it into the fray of geopolitical tensions between Beijing and Washington, analysts and lawyers say.

value.title: Nvidia Deal to Bring AI Everywhere
value.excerpt: Acquisition of chip designer ARM Holdings is a big bet on a world of ubiquitous smart chips and sensors intelligently operating independently with low power demands to create the "internet of everything" and dramatically reduce the friction in our lives.

value.title: Record chip deal lands Nvidia in crosshairs of US-China tensions
value.excerpt: Nvidia's planned purchase of UK-based Arm gives US firm serious sway in an industry crucial to global tech supremacy.

value.title: Brit chip maker Arm gets snapped up by US graphics giant Nvidia
value.excerpt: Nvidia has confirmed that it's acquiring UK chip maker Arm from Japanese owner SoftBank in a US$40 billion deal made up of a combination of shares and cash, though the move is yet to undergo regulatory scrutiny.

value.title: Nvidia's $40 billion Arm bet all about data centers, edge computing, AI
value.excerpt: Arm combination is compelling on multiple fronts and could be "a first class data center platform" but now the parties just need regulators to buy into the deal.

value.title: Chip maker Nvidia takes a $40B chance on Arm Holdings
value.excerpt: Nvidia's deal to buy Arm would launch the processor maker as a world-class power with reach into servers and cell phones - if regulators allow it.

value.title: NVIDIA Acquires ARM to Shake Up Chip Industry
value.excerpt: NVIDIA’s massive purchase of ARM for $40 billion-plus will have some profound implications on AI and its rival, Intel.

value.title: Nvidia confirms it’s buying Arm for $40B to expand its AI efforts
value.excerpt: Graphics hardware and AI giant Nvidia has confirmed its long-rumored acquisition of UK-based chip design firm Arm in a $40 billion transaction.

value.title: Nvidia will buy Arm for up to $40 billion, combining smartphone, GPU powerhouses
value.excerpt: Nvidia is set to buy Arm for as much as $40 billion, the largest semiconductor deal ever. Nvidia says that it will use Arm's CPUs to bolster its AI technology.

value.title: ARM: UK-based chip designer sold to Nvidia

value.title: Even if Elon Musk's Neuralink brain chip never gives us telepathy, it could do wonders for animal testing
value.excerpt: Elon Musk hosted a live demo from his company Neuralink showing a pig named Gertrude with a computer chip in her brain.

value.title: Switch 4K gaming could be added with new dock chip swap, AI upscaling
value.excerpt: Nintendo reportedly tells developers to update their games to run at 4K, hinting the new Switch model revision will output 4K.

value.title: Nvidia RTX 3090, 3080, 3070 GPU: Specs, Price, And Release Date Detailed
value.excerpt: Nvidia revealed its new RTX 3000 line of Ampere-powered GPU earlier in the month--the RTX 3090, 3080, and 3070 cards. The new 3000 series is the second generation of RTX graphics cards that will run features like real-time ray tracing with much higher performance than current RTX cards.

value.title: Rambus Advances HBM2E Performance to 4.0 Gbps for AI/ML Training Applications
value.excerpt: PRNewswire/ -- Rambus Inc. (NASDAQ: RMBS), a premier silicon IP and chip provider making data faster and safer, today announced it has achieved a record 4 Gbps performance with the Rambus HBM2E memory interface solution consisting of a fully-integrated PHY and controller.

value.title: Microsoft’s updated DeepSpeed can train trillion-parameter AI models with fewer GPUs
value.excerpt: The newest version of Microsoft's DeepSpeed library includes optimizations for training trillion-parameter machine learning models.

value.title: MediaTek to announce 6nm Arm chips for Chromebooks next year
value.excerpt: MediaTek has had a pretty impressive year in the mobile and TV market. A new report says it plans to launch a new processor for affordable Chromebooks that will be similar to Apple’s upcoming Arm-based processors for MacBooks.

value.title: Startup Raises $45 Million to Predict Faults in Chips Before They Fail
value.excerpt: Tecs sells tools to identify areas for improvement in new chips and anticipate potential failures in the field. The company said it serves "some of the largest" electronics vendors in the data center,

value.title: Tempering Your Company's Expectations For AI
value.excerpt: Most modern AI is glorified machine learning (ML) at best. Even the most advanced lacks any comprehension or understanding of what it is doing. You have a black box; you plug data into it, and you get out some (hopefully) correct results.

value.title: Computer chips that can read our brains have moved from sci-fi to reality, for better and worse
value.excerpt: The near-term applications will mostly benefit society, but the danger of a dystopian future is becoming more real, too.

The new 3000 series is the second generation of RTX graphics cards that will run features like real-time ray tracing with much higher performance than current RTX cards.

value.title: Neousys Technology Launches NRU-120S, NVIDIA Jetson AGX Xavier Powered Edge AI Solution
value.excerpt: NRU-120S series is a new rugged edge AI-based video analytics solution capable of video recording, transcoding, real-time inference, etc.

value.title: Nvidia tells us more about how well the RTX 3090 GPU performs 8K gaming
value.excerpt: Nvidia’s GeForce RTX 3090 launch saw the firm declare that its top-end Ampere graphics card can handle 8K gaming smoothly – meaning at 60 frames per second (fps) – but now further details have been shared on what kind of frame-rates we can expect with various games,

value.title: Glaxo’s biology research with novel Cerebras machine shows hardware may change how AI is done
value.excerpt: A novel computer system built by Cerebras Systems of Los Altos, California, is already leading to changes in the way drug giant Glaxo builds large neural nets for drug development.
